vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
σκηνο-πηγία, ἡ,
setting up of tents: nest-building, ἡ τῆς χελιδόνος σ. [Refs 4th c.BC+]
__2 feast of tents or tabernacles, [LXX+NT+1st c.AD+]; σύλλογος τῆς σ. [Refs]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
§ (Feast of) Tabernacles
primarily a pitching of tents or booths; hence, the feast of tabernacles or booths, instituted in memory of the forty years' wandering of the Israelites in the desert, and as a season of gratitude for the ingathering of harvest, celebrated for eight days, commencing on the 15th of Tisri, Jn. 7:2*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: fiesta de los Tabernáculos o las Enramadas (un festival religioso judío que conmemora la provisión de Dios durante los tiempos errantes en el desierto)
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
住棚節 (約 7:2)
猶太人節期,自提斯留月(西曆十月)十五號起歷時七天,一方面紀念祖先在曠野
住帳棚的飄流歲月,一方面歡慶農作物的收成.節慶間,猶太人會用樹葉繁茂的
枝子在屋頂或院子搭棚子,並以水果花卉裝飾,在裡面吃喝慶祝.
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
住棚节 (约 7:2)
犹太人节期,自提斯留月(西历十月)十五号起历时七天,一方面纪念祖先在旷野
住帐棚的飘流岁月,一方面欢庆农作物的收成.节庆间,犹太人会用树叶繁茂的
枝子在屋顶或院子搭棚子,并以水果花卉装饰,在里面吃喝庆祝.
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: Lễ Lều Tạm; lễ dựng lều (Sukkot hoặc Succot)
